skill.name: Agent Communication Debugger
skill.description: Diagnoses and debugs A2A agent communication issues including agent status, message routing, transport connectivity, and log analysis. Use when agents aren't responding, messages aren't being delivered, routing is incorrect, or when debugging orchestrator, coder-agent, tester-agent communication problems.
skill.summary: Diagnoses and debugs A2A agent communication issues including agent status, message routing, transpo...
skill.author: EGAdams

security_audit.summary: The skill performs legitimate debugging functions with appropriate security measures. It reads system logs, checks process status, and tests message transport. The scripts are read-only diagnostics tools that don't modify system state or exfiltrate sensitive data.

content.value_statement: Agents not talking to each other? This skill systematically diagnoses A2A communication problems. It checks agent status, validates configurations, analyzes logs, and tests message delivery to get your multi-agent system working again.
actual_capabilities: Check which agent processes are running on the system
Read and validate agent.json configuration files
Analyze agent logs for errors and routing decisions
Test message transport layers (WebSocket and RAG board)
Send test messages to verify communication flow
Diagnose routing logic and agent discovery issues
limitations: Requires agent system to be installed in a2a_communicating_agents directory
Cannot fix agent code bugs - only identifies issues
Needs read access to logs and configuration files
Test scripts require Python 3.10+ with rich library

use_cases.title: Agent System Health Check
use_cases.description: Run complete diagnostics on multi-agent systems to verify all components are communicating properly and identify bottlenecks.

use_cases.title: Debug Message Routing
use_cases.description: When messages go to wrong agents or get lost, trace the routing decisions and fix configuration issues.

use_cases.title: Production Agent Monitoring
use_cases.description: Monitor agent communication in production environments and quickly identify when agents stop responding.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Health Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Check if all agents are running
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the status of all agents in my A2A system. Are the orchestrator, coder, and tester agents running? Show me a summary of what's working and what isn't.

prompt_templates.title: Message Delivery Test
prompt_templates.scenario: Test if messages are being delivered
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a test to see if messages are being delivered properly in my agent system. Send a test message and check if the orchestrator receives and processes it.

prompt_templates.title: Routing Diagnosis
prompt_templates.prompt: My messages are routing to the wrong agent. Check the orchestrator logs for recent routing decisions and help me understand why it's choosing the wrong agent.

prompt_templates.title: Complete System Diagnostic
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete diagnostic of my A2A agent system. Check agent processes, configurations, logs, transport connectivity, and message flow. Provide a detailed report of any issues found.

output_examples.input: Check if my agents are communicating properly
output: - No recent activity in orchestrator logs (last message 30 min ago)
- WebSocket server responding but no message traffic
Recommendation: Send a test message to verify message transport is working.

best_practices: Always check agent process status first - most issues are simply agents not running
Run the test_message.py script before asking for help - it provides baseline diagnostic data
Check logs chronologically - start with the oldest error to find the root cause
anti_patterns: Don't restart all agents at once - this can mask intermittent issues
Avoid making multiple configuration changes simultaneously - change one thing at a time
Don't ignore transport layer - even if agents are running, message delivery can fail

faq.question: Which agent systems does this support?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for A2A (Agent-to-Agent) systems using the orchestrator, coder-agent, tester-agent architecture with WebSocket or RAG board transport.

faq.question: What permissions does it need?
faq.answer: The skill needs read access to agent logs, configuration files, and process information. Test scripts require Python 3.10+ with the rich library.

faq.question: Can it fix agent issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, this is a diagnostic tool that identifies problems. It provides specific commands and recommendations for you to implement fixes.

faq.question: How do I run the test scripts manually?
faq.answer: Use: python .claude/skills/agent-debug/scripts/test_message.py for message testing, or python .claude/skills/agent-debug/scripts/test_websocket.py for WebSocket connectivity.

faq.question: What if agents are installed in a different location?
faq.answer: The skill expects agents in a2a_communicating_agents/ directory. For custom locations, you'll need to modify the paths in the diagnostic commands.

faq.question: Does it work with cloud-based agents?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for local agent systems. Cloud deployments may have different log locations and process monitoring requirements.
